items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees.  Board Policy 6100 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval.  All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the bid limit of $83,400 shall have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts that, although are not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts and purchase orders for the period of December 10, 2012 through February 9, 2013 as noted in the attached documents.

items.item_details:
The curriculum proposals have been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and by the Instructional Policies and Curriculum Committee (IPCC) acting on behalf of the local Academic Senate. The rigor of the approval process assures that each new recommendation has substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and fills a clear need not being served by existing curriculum.
	 
The proposed courses are intended to increase success rates of students completing statistics for non-STATS majors and meet Carnegie/San Jose City College Foundation for Advancement of Teaching grant requirements.
	 
MATH 064: Integrated Statistics I
MATH 065: Integrated Statistics II

items.item_details:
On August 14, 2012, the Board of Trustees unanimously approved Board Agenda Item F-13 and awarded a contract to Cupertino Electric, Inc. (CEI) in the amount of $149,784.91 for the emergency work due to the Evergreen Valley College (EVC) power outage. This agenda item is to increase the aforementioned amount by an additional $10,166.22, totaling $159,951.13 for final payment on a late invoice due to an unresolved issue with CEIâs subcontractor. Once this was resolved, the additional cost of $10,166.22 was invoiced to the District.  
	 
Therefore, it is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve this final payment on a late invoice and increase the initial amount of $149,784.91 that was unanimously approved by the Board of Trustees, by an additional $10,166.22, totaling $159,951.13 for the emergency work due to the EVC power outage.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve this final payment on a late invoice for the emergency work of Cupertino Electric, Inc. during the Evergreen Valley College power outage.
items.item_text: Final Payment on Late Invoice for Emergency Work Due to Evergreen Valley College Power Outage

items.item_details: The district purchased its original library system in 1994 using TTIPS funds and is in critical need of refresh. Therefore, the district seeks to update to the latest version of hardware and software to ensure our students have access to academic library resources.

items.item_details:
Change Order #001 – BHM CONSTRUCTION, INC. – EVC Interim Police Facility & G-2010 Offices, Project #32107 & #32306
	 
On November 27, 2012 the Board awarded a contract in the amount of $1,108,300 to BHM CONSTRUCTION, INC. (BHM) for construction of the Measure G-2010 project – EVC Interim Police Facility & G-2010 Offices.  This project provides a temporary location for SJECCD Police operations during the upcoming construction of the new Police station and establishes on-campus offices for the Measure G-2010 program/construction management team. 
	 
Construction contracts often times experience unforeseen conditions, coordination gaps and/or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  BHM CONSTRUCTION, INC. submitted written pricing proposals for changes detailed in an attachment that include additional or deleted materials, equipment, labor, time extensions as applicable and the prescribed mark-ups.  The Architect, Program Manager and Inspector of Record subsequently reviewed the proposals to ensure the pricing reflects industry rates and recommend the approval of Change Order #1 in the amount of $15,490.
	 
Repair broken water line at Field Restroom               $1,678
Existing underground utility information did not indicate a waterline underneath pavement in the accessway for construction activities.  When the waterline leaked, BHM uncovered a break at a corroded joint which may have been the cause of the break.
	 
Relocate 10” waterline                                                $12,543
Existing underground utility information indicated a 10” waterline which in the Contract Documents, the Contractor was directed to tap into for the installation of the new fire hydrant line.  Upon tapping into the line it was discovered that the line had been abandoned but not documented.  In conjunction with additional documentation investigation of the congested area of underground utilities, BHM subsequently uncovered an active waterline to use, but needed a specially configured, “hot tapped” connection to allow the fire line to remain active during the installation.
	 
LCN Closers                                                               $940
It was determined that 2 doors needed closing hardware.
	 
Circuit Breakers at Fitness Portables                          $715
Upon reconnecting power to the existing Fitness Portables after the switchgear was relocated closer to the Interim Police Station and G-2010 Offices, it was discovered that the original circuit breakers were undersized and should be upgraded as part of this project for a safe re-installation. 
	 
Non-Removal of 6” waterline                                     
The existing 6” waterline servicing the LETC fire hydrant was upsized to 10” to accommodate the new Interim Police & G-2010 Office fire hydrant.  It was determined to be less disruptive to the site to abandon the existing 6” waterline in place so BHM issued a credit for the removal and disposal work that they no longer were required to perform.
	 
The Board is asked to approve Change Order #1 to BHM CONSTRUCTION, INC. in the amount of $15,490 for the Interim Police Facility & G-2010 Offices project at EVC.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order #001 to BHM CONSTRUCTION, INC. in the amount of $15,490 for the Evergreen Valley College Interim Police Facility & G-2010 Offices, Project #32107 & #32306.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Change Order #001 with BHM CONSTRUCTION, INC. in the amount of $15,490 for the Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Interim Police Facility & G-2010 Offices.
items.item_text_raw: 2. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Change Order #001 with BHM CONSTRUCTION, INC. in the amount of $15,490 for the Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Interim Police Facility & G-2010 Offices.

items.item_details:
PAA Revision #002 – AEDIS ARCHITECTS – Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Central Plant and Police Station Renovation, Project #32306.
	 
On January 10, 2012 the Board awarded a design contract in the amount of $855,000 to AEDIS ARCHITECTS (AEDIS) for the Measure G-2010 project – EVC Central Plant and Police Station Renovation project. A revision in the amount of $18,118 was approved by the Board on July 10, 2012 to add the design of a co-generation system to the scope of work and to align the contract amount with the increased estimate of construction per the original Agreement. The original Agreement also established the perimeters of the construction work as abutting the anticipated boundary for the future South Campus Development project.  
	 
As part of their permit approval, the City of San Jose Fire Department has required the installation of a fire hydrant, a fire access road and a temporary “hammerhead” turn-around for fire trucks that could be removed once the permanent fire lane is extended to the South Campus Development. Subsequently AEDIS prepared construction documents that included these improvements and submitted them as part of the initial review by DSA.  
	 
At this time the South Campus Development project has now completed Schematic Design, siting the new Math, Science and Social Science building farther away from the Central Plant than originally envisioned.  This more distant boundary now allows adjusting the limit of work for the Central Plant project enabling the “hammerhead” to be located more strategically in the field to the south end of the project.  In doing this, three mature trees will be saved, existing light poles can remain and less paving will be required.  The construction cost savings and saving of mature trees provides a greater benefit to the project than the cost of this revision to the AEDIS contract.
	 
The Board is asked to approve PAA Revision #002 to AEDIS ARCHITECTS in the amount of $7,579 for the Central Plant and Police Station Renovation project at EVC.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve PAA Revision #002 to AEDIS ARCHITECTS in the amount of $7,579 for the Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Central Plant and Police Station Renovation, Project #32306.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) Revision #002 with AEDIS ARCHITECTS in the amount of $7,579 for the Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Central Plant and Police Station Renovation.
items.item_text_raw: 3. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) Revision #002 with AEDIS ARCHITECTS in the amount of $7,579 for the Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Central Plant and Police Station Renovation.

items.item_details:
Design Services Agreement â MARCY WONG DONN LOGAN ARCHITECTS San Jose City College (SJCC) Theater & Vocational Technology Project
	 
At the Board meeting held on July 10, 2012 the Board approved a design agreement with MARCY WONG DONN LOGAN ARCHITECTS to provide Programing phase design services only for the SJCC Theater & Vocational Technology project.  Extension of their services into full design and construction phase services was contingent upon successful performance of Programming and a validated construction budget.  The programming phase has now been completed with a reconciled program and budget, and SJCC has been very pleased with the effort by MARCY WONG DONN LOGAN.  At the conclusion of the Programming Phase, SJCC negotiated an agreement with MARCY WONG DONN LOGAN ARCHITECTS to continue their services and provide full design (including DSA coordination, construction administration and closeout) for the project.
	 
	 
The Board is asked to approve an Agreement with MARCY WONG DONN LOGAN ARCHITECTS for architectural design and construction phase administration services in the amount of $2,677,185 for the Theater & Vocational Technology Project at SJCC.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Agreement with MARCY WONG DONN LOGAN ARCHITECTS for architectural design and construction administration services in the amount of $2,677,185 for the Theater & Vocational Technology Project at SJCC.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Design Services Agreement with MARCY WONG DONN LOGAN ARCHITECTS for Architectural design & construction phase administration at San Jose City College (SJCC) Theater & Vocational Technology Project.
items.item_text_raw: 4. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Design Services Agreement with MARCY WONG DONN LOGAN ARCHITECTS for Architectural design & construction phase administration at San Jose City College (SJCC) Theater & Vocational Technology Project.

items.item_details:
Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) â JONI L. JANECKI ASSOCIATES â PAA #SJCC-01 Campus Site Improvements, Landscape Master Planning and Pre-Design Services
	 
JONI L. JANECKI ASSOCIATES will provide Pre-Design and Programming Services to develop a Landscape Master Plan and Landscape Standards for the campus.  The Landscape Master Plan will provide the framework within which individual Campus Site Improvement Projects will be awarded, designed and constructed in phases to coordinate with the construction and demolition of other campus buildings and their schedules.
A PAA to provide Master Planning and Pre-Design Services has been negotiated with JONI L. JANECKI ASSOCIATES. 
	 
The Board is asked to approve PAA SJCC-01 to JONI L. JANECKI ASSOCIATES in the amount of $117,600 for Master Planning and Pre-Design Services for Project #31116 Campus Site Improvements.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Project Assignment Amendment with JONI L. JANECKI ASSOCIATES in the amount of $117,600 for the Campus Site Improvements Design Services at San Jose City College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) San Jose City College (SJCC)-01 JONI L. JANECKI ASSOCIATES for the Campus Site Improvements, Landscape Master Planning and Pre-Design Services.

items.item_details:
On February 28, 2013, President Barak Obama issued a Proclamation declaring March 2013 as National Women's History Month. In support of this Presidential Proclamation and to acknowledge the extraordinary contributions of women to our nation, community and district, the campuses have organized many events focused on women's achievements. 
	 
It is recommended the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution 31213-2 declaring March 2013 as National Women's History Month.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution No. 31213-2 in support of March 2013 as National Women's History Month.

items.item_text_raw: 7. National Women's History Month - Resolution No. 31213-2

items.item_details: Over eleven million immigrant aspiring citizens contribute in significant ways to strengthen our nation and communities. The San Jose-Evergreen Community College District is committed to its vision of opportunity, equity and social justice for all inhabitants of the United States and has worked hard to support the rights of members of our district community. Adoption of Resolution No. 31213-3 will send a strong message to the 113th Congress of the United that we urge them to quickly enact comprehensive immigration reform and pass into federal law the DREAM Act.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution No. 31213-3 Citizenship for Aspiring Citizens of the United States.

items.item_details:
Schematic design presentation for the South Campus Development at Evergreen Valley College
	 
At the Board meeting held July 10, 2012 the Board approved the Lease/Leaseback delivery method for the EVC South Campus Development project. At that same meeting the Board approved a design agreement with HMC Architects to provide design services for the project.
	 
HMC completed the schematic design phase of the project in February, 2013.  A presentation was made to the Project Design Committee on February 8, 2013 and to President Yong on March 5, 2013.  The project was approved to move forward at each presentation.  In keeping with the Boardâs request, the schematic design for the South Campus Development project is presented to the Board to provide insight into the progress of the project.

items.item_details:
On February 12, 2013, the Board scheduled a Training and Development Study Session. The goal of the session was to review model practices and standards for “effective trusteeship” with a special emphasis on the importance of speaking “with one voice.” The session reviewed guidelines about the governance role of the board as policy makers differentiated from the administrative and managerial role of the Chancellor in the implementation of board policy. Review sessions and discussion centered on six different areas as follows:
	 
• Board Vision/Mission/Goals
• Effective Governance Processes: The Carver Governance Model
• Current Board Structure: Committees and Task Forces
• Board Self Evaluation and Workplan Development
• Board Skills Development Program
• Board Master Calendar
	 
This item presents a “Summary Report” including  (1) a listing of proposed board development and training issues as well as internal and external opportunities to schedule this training; and, (2) A Master Calendar listing critical board topics and presentations to be scheduled in subsequent board meeting agendas.
items.item_text: Board Training and Development Study Sessions: Summary and Outcomes
